block.p: Mindy Rebecca Feinberg and Dr. Stefan Harris Gutow were married yesterday evening at the American Visionary Art Museum in Baltimore. Rabbi William Kuhn officiated.

The bride, 35, is an assistant professor of psychology at Towson University in Maryland. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin and received a master's in developmental psychology from Columbia and a Ph.D. in school, clinical and community psychology from the University of Pennsylvania. She also directed an educational program for orphaned and homeless children in Guayaquil, Ecuador.
Mindy Rebecca Feinberg and Dr. Stefan Harris Gutow were married yesterday evening at the American Visionary Art Museum in Baltimore. Rabbi William Kuhn officiated.

The bride, 35, is an assistant professor of psychology at Towson University in Maryland. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin and received a master's in developmental psychology from Columbia and a Ph.D. in school, clinical and community psychology from the University of Pennsylvania. She also directed an educational program for orphaned and homeless children in Guayaquil, Ecuador.

She is the daughter of Helen Feinberg of Mount Kisco, N.Y., and the late Jacob Feinberg, who lived in Bedford, N.Y. Her mother is a social worker on the staff of the University Hospital at Westchester Medical Center in Valhalla, N.Y. The bride's mother and father also were the founders of Northwind Kennels, a dog and cat boarding kennel in Bedford.

Dr. Gutow, 32, is a urologist with Chesapeake Urology Associates, a group practice in Baltimore. He graduated magna cum laude from Bowdoin College and received his medical degree from the University of Michigan.

He is the son of Dr. Gary Gutow of Nashville and the late Kathryn Gutow. His father is a retinal surgeon and the founder and the president of Retina-Vitreous Associates, a group practice in Nashville.
